hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Log Price Ratio Mean Reversion in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: The natural logarithm of the BTC/ETH price ratio exhibits mean-reverting behavior around its 30-day rolling z-score when the market is in a NEUTRAL regime, creating profitable pairs trading opportunities when the z-score exceeds ±1.5 standard deviations.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During neutral market conditions, BTC and ETH tend to move in relative equilibrium as both are large-cap blue chips. Extreme divergences typically correct as capital rotates between the two dominant assets. The 30-day window captures medium-term equilibrium levels without being too reactive to short-term noise.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH log price ratio 30-day z-score > +1.5 (go long ETH/short BTC)
BTC/ETH log price ratio 30-day z-score < -1.5 (go long BTC/short ETH)
Position sizing: 1% risk per trade, dollar-neutral portfolio
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the mean reversion success rate falls below 55% with a Sharpe ratio < 0.8 over 100+ trades in neutral regimes, or if divergences persist beyond 2.5 sigma without reverting.
